page.title: 03ECOLOGY
page.content: The pollution of the River Trent from sewerage and industrial waste has improved since 1975. At Shardlow the River Trent is joined by the relatively clean River Derwent which will soon become the most highly utilised water supply in the country. On this stretch of water there are flood defence works as it is very prone to flooding and there is a River Analysis Height and Recording Station for this purpose. The Severn Trent Water Authority control effluent and water quality, and in 1972 an important abstraction point was constructed at Church Wilne for the Carbon Treatment of water to control taste and odour. The Church Wilne Reservoir receives water from the abstraction point. Gravel pits are worked for sand and gravel extraction in this section.
